subject: Programming
title: The Curse of Knowledge
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Curse of Knowledge usable.

hook.text: Once you understand something, you can't imagine not understanding it. That's the curse.

buildup.text: Developers write code that makes perfect sense to them but baffles colleagues with less context.

discovery.text: The curse of knowledge explains why documentation, comments, and naming feel unnecessary to the author.

twist.text: You six months from now is effectively a different person. Future-you will be cursed too.

climax.text: The antidote is empathy â€” deliberately imagining the reader who doesn't share your context.

punchline.text: Write for the person who doesn't know what you know.

quiz.question: What is the curse of knowledge?
options: Not being able to imagine not understanding something
